brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate whether flexion of bronchial tip of a left-sided
      double lumen endobronchial tube prevents tube misplacement to the right mainstem bronchus.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Pretreatment of a Left-sided Double-lumen Tube to Prevent Its Misplacement to the Right Mainstem Bronchus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing thoracic surgery that require the placement of left-sided
             double-lumen tubes

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Abnormal anatomy of tracheobronchial tree

          -  Intraluminal lesion in the left or right mainstem bronchus

          -  Anticipated difficult intubation

intervention.description: Intubation is performed without transforming the shape of the bonchial tipof a double lumen tube.
Intubation is performed with the double lumen tube, which bronchial tip has been bent 45 degrees and maintained for 5 min.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with intubation to right mainstem bronchus
primary_outcome.time_frame: An expected average of 5minutes after intubation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with airway injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: An expected average of 5 minutes after bilateral lung ventilation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
